001package edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.controller;
002
003import android.os.Bundle;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.View;
006import android.view.ViewGroup;
007import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
008import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
009import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
010import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
011import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
012import androidx.navigation.Navigation;
013import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
014import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
015import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.adapter.PatternLibraryAdapter;
016import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.databinding.FragmentPatternLibraryBinding;
017import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.model.entity.Pattern;
018import edu.cnm.deepdive.sereknitty.viewmodel.PatternLibraryViewModel;
019
020/**
021 * This is the {@link PatternLibraryFragment} and it holds the logic that recalls {@link Pattern}
022 * instances that are represented by individual items in the {@link RecyclerView} in the UI.
023 */
024@AndroidEntryPoint
025public class PatternLibraryFragment extends Fragment {
026
027  private static final String TAG = PatternLibraryFragment.class.getSimpleName();
028  private FragmentPatternLibraryBinding binding;
029  private PatternLibraryViewModel viewModel;
030
031  /**
032   * This is the required empty constructor that Hilt needs to do its thing.
033   */
034  public PatternLibraryFragment() {
035    // Required empty public constructor
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container,
040      Bundle savedInstanceState) {
041    // Inflate the layout for this fragment
042    binding = FragmentPatternLibraryBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
043    return binding.getRoot();
044
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
049    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
050    ViewModelProvider provider = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity());
051    viewModel = provider.get(PatternLibraryViewModel.class);
052    getLifecycle().addObserver(viewModel);
053    LifecycleOwner owner = getViewLifecycleOwner();
054    viewModel
055        .getPatterns()
056        .observe(owner, (patterns) -> {
057          PatternLibraryAdapter adapter = new PatternLibraryAdapter(requireContext(), patterns,
058              (pattern, position, clickedView) -> {
059                Navigation.findNavController(binding.getRoot())
060                    .navigate(PatternLibraryFragmentDirections
061                        .navigateToPatternReader(pattern.getId()));
062              });
063          binding.patternLibraryList.setAdapter(adapter);
064        });
065    binding.addPattern.setOnClickListener((button) ->
066        Navigation.findNavController(button)
067            .navigate(PatternLibraryFragmentDirections.navigateToPatternBuilder()));
068
069
070  }
071}
